member.summary: Ensures the connection is open. Warning! This method will not reopen a connection that once was opened and will raise an error.

member.name: M:Serenity.Data.ConnectionExtensions.GetCurrentActualTransaction(System.Data.IDbConnection)
member.summary: Gets the current actual transaction for a connection if any. Most of the time, a connection will only have one transaction, but in .NET it is not possible to know what is that transaction. Serenity wraps a connection (WrappedConnection) so that running transaction if any is available to get from the connection object.
member.returns: The current transaction for a connection

member.summary: Sets the default command timeout for given connection. Only works with IHasCommandTimeout (WrappedConnection) instances, which are usually created by SqlConnections.NewXyz methods.

member.name: M:Serenity.Data.UnitOfWork.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Defers starting of the transaction until the connection is opened if it has a statechange event, or the first moment connection property is read. If the connection is already open this flag has no effect. If the passed connection does not have a statechange event and is accessed somewhere else (e.g. other than via the UnitOfWork.Connection property), it may cause consistency issues so ensure it is not accessed via other means.

member.name: M:Serenity.Data.UnitOfWork.#ctor(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.Data.IsolationLevel,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified System.Data.IsolationLevel value.
member.param: Defers starting of the transaction until the connection is opened if it has a statechange event, or the first moment connection property is read. If the connection is already open this flag has no effect. If the passed connection does not have a statechange event and is accessed somewhere else (e.g. other than via the UnitOfWork.Connection property), it may cause consistency issues so ensure it is not accessed via other means.

member.name: M:Serenity.Data.SqlQuery.OrderByFirst(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts a field name or an SQL expression to the start of ORDER BY clause.
member.param: A field or an SQL expression.
True to add a " DESC" suffix.
member.remarks: This method is designed to help apply user defined orders (for example by clicking headers on a grid) to a query with existing order. SQL server throws an error if a field is used more than once in ORDER BY expression, so this function first removes normal and DESC versions of the expression from the ORDER BY statement.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Gets the type of the row.

member.name: P:Serenity.Data.Mapping.UpdatableExtensionAttribute.Alias
member.summary: The join alias in this row that brings in extension table fields as view fields

member.name: P:Serenity.Data.Mapping.UpdatableExtensionAttribute.ThisKey
member.summary: Name of the key field in this table. If not specified, ID field of this table will be used.

member.name: P:Serenity.Data.Mapping.UpdatableExtensionAttribute.OtherKey
member.summary: Name of the key field in extension table. If not specified, ID field of extension table is assumed, unless there is a field with matching name to ThisKey in extension table.

member.name: P:Serenity.Data.Mapping.UpdatableExtensionAttribute.FilterField
member.summary: Name of a field in extension table that will be filtered in extension table in addition to key. For example, if you have a CustomerAddresses table, and your join condition is T0.CustomerID = ca.CustomerID and ca.AddressType = 'Billing', your FilterField is AddressType and your FilterValue is 'Billing'

member.name: P:Serenity.Data.Mapping.UpdatableExtensionAttribute.FilterValue
member.summary: Constant value of a field in extension table that will be filtered in extension table in addition to key. For example, if you have a CustomerAddresses table, and your join condition is T0.CustomerID = ca.CustomerID and ca.AddressType = 'Billing', your FilterField is AddressType and your FilterValue is 'Billing'

member.name: P:Serenity.Data.Mapping.UpdatableExtensionAttribute.PresenceField
member.summary: This extension should only be inserted if this field is equal to PresenceValue For example, you might have a PersonType column in PersonRow and student record should only be created (if not already) if PersonType = "Student".

member.name: P:Serenity.Data.Mapping.UpdatableExtensionAttribute.PresenceValue
member.summary: This extension should only be inserted if PresenceField value is equal to this one. For example, you might have a PersonType column in PersonRow and student record should only be created (if not already) if PersonType = "Student".

member.name: P:Serenity.Data.Mapping.UpdatableExtensionAttribute.CascadeDelete
member.summary: Delete extension record if this record is deleted
